original_solution_mapping.L2: If the pipe fills the tank with water at the rate of 10 gallons per hour, it will take 3000/10 = <<3000/10=300>>300 hours to fill the tank to 3/4 of its capacity

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 6973.
    Returns: the time in hours to fill the tank to 3/4 of its capacity.
    """
    # L1
    target_fraction = Fraction(3, 4) # 3/4 of its capacity
    tank_capacity = 4000 # capacity of 4000 gallons
    target_volume = target_fraction * tank_capacity

    # L2
    fill_rate = 10 # rate of 10 gallons per hour
    time_to_fill = target_volume / fill_rate

    # FA
    answer = time_to_fill
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: If the pipe fills the tank with water at the rate of {fill_rate} gallons per hour, it will take {target_volume}/{fill_rate} = <<{target_volume}/{fill_rate}={time_to_fill}>>{time_to_fill} hours to fill the tank to 3/4 of its capacity

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: If the pipe fills the tank with water at the rate of 10 gallons per hour, it will take 16003/4/10 = <<16003/4/10=16003/40>>16003/40 hours to fill the tank to 3/4 of its capacity

explanation: Incorrect operation. The calculation should use '*' but used '+' instead.
